N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 458.5 - Supportive services to residents in other certified facilities

State Regulations

Social services districts, in accordance with section
313.2
of this Title, must provide
follow-up visits to and contact persons who are State charges, as defined in
section
2
(19)
of the Social Services Law and who are
residing in residential care facilities. Social services districts must also
provide other services, as determined necessary by such districts, to persons
in facilities, other than family-type homes for adults which are certified by
the department, the Department of Health, the Office of Mental Health or the

Office of Mental Retardation and Developmental Disabilities. The specific
responsibilities of each social services district include: (a) monitoring the placement of an individual
whose placement in the facility was arranged by the district; (b) assessing the need for and providing
financial management services, such as acting as representative payee to
voluntary clients, as determined necessary by the district; and
(c) providing or arranging for other services
as determined appropriate by the district. Notes
